result.execSummary:
The defendant David W Eggert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant David W Eggert in court with attorney Ryan O'Hara.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State moves to remove the enhancer.  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented and discussed.  Guilty plea entered to straight disorderly conduct without the enhancer.  The Court finds plea is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given and finds the defendant guilty.  State relates.  Attorney O'Hara relates.  Court relates and orders:

Court costs - 60 DTP
Must submit DNA sample and pay surcharge

Order for DNA given to the defendant in court.

Defendant David W Eggert in court with attorney Ryan O'Hara.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant to complete 50 hours of community service. Reset.  Plea hearing scheduled for November 4, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for David W Eggert
Current: PO Box 1162, 1335 Web St, Cumberland, WI 54829 United States  (Effective: 06-09-2015)
Prior: 429 3rd Street, Clayton, WI 54004 United States

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.  
Must have no contact with Tiffany B. 
Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.  
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold.
Defendant provide updated address to the Court before release.
6/5/2015: THIS BOND IS AMENDED FROM "MUST HAVE NO CONTACT WITH TIFFANY B." TO "MUST HAVE NO ABUSIVE CONTACT WITH TIFFANY B." ALL OTHER CONDITIONS REMAIN IN FULL FORCE AND EFFECT.

Defendant David W Eggert in court with attorney Ryan O'Hara.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense moves for bond modification to change condition of "no contact with Tiffany B" to "no abusive contact with Tiffany B".  All other conditions of previous bond to remain in full force and effect.
Court grants motion.
